ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic microeconomic theory with real world applications, review of fundamental mathematic concepts
Core economics principles, real life lessons and applications, life lessons, career advice through the lens of Econ, review of key mathematical skills
I learned the basics of microeconomics in a broad way.
A good understanding of the foundational principles of microeconomics

I learned the basics of microeconomics and all the econ terminology that people use in their daily lives. Additionally, Tolga's applications of microeconomics to daily life will certainly serve as a life lessons in the future. All in all a class very relevant to the world we inhabit, and a professor who makes sure to teach it that way.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: clarity of professor, provides helpful in-depth information and examples, really encourages learning and developing mastery of the material by offering ample opportunity for questions and clarifications, provides every opportunity for success with extensive exam review opportunities
Weaknesses: not a lot of student engagement
There could be more review material.

Strengths: Tolga is hilarious and incredibly well versed in economics
Weaknesses: the course is very exam heavy, with 80% of the grade relying on the midterm and the final; that is not how real life works and in my opinion it is not the best way to test a student's learning

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to anyone looking for a basic microeconomics course. It covers the theory and practice in an in-depth way. Accessible to students without a strong basis in math
Absolutely, it helps you think about "common sense" concepts in a more concrete, structured and logical way in ways that are applicable in all fields and all facets of life

I started out taking this class only because I needed it as a prereq for Global. At first, Tolga scared me and the material seemed impossible. Stick it out! By the end of the semester it was one of my favorite classes, and Tolga one of my favorite professors. The skills you learn in the end are totally worth it.
